page.title: 17Stock's Mill
page.content: Stocks Mill is a Post mill, it balances and turns on a big post in the middle of the round house. The tail pole was used to turn the mill so that the sails caught the wind; it sticks through the staircase and there is a lever which was used to lift the stairs while the mill was being turned. The Crown Tree is a big beam on top of the Post; when this turned, all the mill turned with it. The sails used to be covered with canvas but they now have wooden shutters. They were sometimes called sweeps. To grind flour 2 stones were used; the bottom, or bed stone, did not move and the top 'runner' stone was turned by a huge cast iron cog wheel attached to a shaft which was turned by the sails. The mill was last used nearly 100 years ago.
